paper_title.ja: パージトラップ・メガボアキャピラリーカラム・GC/FIDによる水中の微量低沸点有機塩素化合物の簡易一斉分析法とその応用
paper_title.en: Simple Simultaneous Determination of the Trace VHCs in Water by Purge Trap・WideBore Capillary Column・Gas Chromatography/ FID and Its Application

description.ja: It has been feared that the contamination of underground water by volatile halocarbon compounds (VHCs) may have spread and become prolonged in the time since it was discovered. A simple method to separate and simultaneously determine trace amounts of VHCs in water has been established and water samples were examined for determining the status of the method. The determination method of VHCs is described hereafter. VHCs were purged from the water sample with high purity helium gas and adsorbed to a collector. The adsorbed VHCs are desorbed by heating to feed to a column 30m long packed with DB-624 0.53mm in diameter cooled at -25℃. Tetrachloroethylene, trichloroethylene, 1,1,1-trichloroethane, trihalomethanes and dichloroethylenes are determined by programmed temperature gas chromatography using a FID. The samples were taken from water supplies in the suburbs of Tokyo and wells near chemical manufacturing plants. This new simple method was applied to the samples. The analytical results indicated that tetrachloroethylene and trichloroethylene were frequently detected in the well water samples near the plants using VHCs, and there were some well waters that were heavily contaminated with the VHCs. The behaviors of those contaminants and their decomposition products (dichloroethylenes) in underground water will have to be further monitored.
description.en: It has been feared that the contamination of underground water by volatile halocarbon compounds (VHCs) may have spread and become prolonged in the time since it was discovered. A simple method to separate and simultaneously determine trace amounts of VHCs in water has been established and water samples were examined for determining the status of the method. The determination method of VHCs is described hereafter. VHCs were purged from the water sample with high purity helium gas and adsorbed to a collector. The adsorbed VHCs are desorbed by heating to feed to a column 30m long packed with DB-624 0.53mm in diameter cooled at -25℃. Tetrachloroethylene, trichloroethylene, 1,1,1-trichloroethane, trihalomethanes and dichloroethylenes are determined by programmed temperature gas chromatography using a FID. The samples were taken from water supplies in the suburbs of Tokyo and wells near chemical manufacturing plants. This new simple method was applied to the samples. The analytical results indicated that tetrachloroethylene and trichloroethylene were frequently detected in the well water samples near the plants using VHCs, and there were some well waters that were heavily contaminated with the VHCs. The behaviors of those contaminants and their decomposition products (dichloroethylenes) in underground water will have to be further monitored.

paper_title.ja: 培養細胞を用いた環境汚染物質の毒性評価-有機錫化合物と微量金属類について
paper_title.en: Toxicity Assessments of Environmental Pollutants Using Cultured Cells -Organotin Compounds and Trace Metals-

description.ja: The purpose of this study is to research the toxicity assessments of environmental pollutants using cultured cells, having whether or not these compounds take some damages in cellular levels. Some cultured leukemia cells were used as a model system to assess the cytotoxicity of various organotin compounds and trace metals. The results of these studies in vitro suggest the following: 1. Judging from LC_<50> values, organometallic compounds were more toxic than that of the trace metals. 2. The viability of cells treated with Se decreased at concentration of 10 μM, as compared with those of other trace metals. The viability of cells treated with Pb did not exhibited similar change at concentration of 1,000 μM. 3. Dibutyltin or tributyltin compounds was observed to be more toxic than the tetrabutyltin or mono-butyltin compounds of the same chain length. 4. Tripropyltin compounds were more toxic than other alkyltin compounds. 5. A difference in toxicity for butyltin compounds between Molt-4 cells and HL-60 cells was observed, the former to be weak than the latter. These results indicate that the cultured cells can be applied to short-term toxicity assessments of environmental pollutants.
description.en: The purpose of this study is to research the toxicity assessments of environmental pollutants using cultured cells, having whether or not these compounds take some damages in cellular levels. Some cultured leukemia cells were used as a model system to assess the cytotoxicity of various organotin compounds and trace metals. The results of these studies in vitro suggest the following: 1. Judging from LC_<50> values, organometallic compounds were more toxic than that of the trace metals. 2. The viability of cells treated with Se decreased at concentration of 10 μM, as compared with those of other trace metals. The viability of cells treated with Pb did not exhibited similar change at concentration of 1,000 μM. 3. Dibutyltin or tributyltin compounds was observed to be more toxic than the tetrabutyltin or mono-butyltin compounds of the same chain length. 4. Tripropyltin compounds were more toxic than other alkyltin compounds. 5. A difference in toxicity for butyltin compounds between Molt-4 cells and HL-60 cells was observed, the former to be weak than the latter. These results indicate that the cultured cells can be applied to short-term toxicity assessments of environmental pollutants.

ヒト正常血清からの抗リン脂質抗体の簡易精製法

paper_title.en: Effect of phospholipids on adsorption and penetration of human T-cell leukemia virus type 1
Simple purification method of the antiphospholipid antibody from normal human plasma

description.en: We have reported that rabbit serum contains a phospholipid (PL)/ganglioside-binding protein which adsorbs to Sephacryl S-400 gel and agglutinates human red blood cells. A new protein similar to the PL/ganglioside-binding protein was simply purified from normal human plasma using Sephacryl S-400, Sepharose CL-4B and DEAE-Sepharose CL-6B columns. The purified protein was found to agglutinate rabbit red blood cells. The hemagglutination was specifically inhibited by two FL, phosphatidylserine and phosphatidylinositol, but not by any other FL, gangliosides, saccharides or glycoproteins tested. From analyses of the N-terminal amino acid sequence and immunological specificity, the protein was identified to be a human immunoglobulin M.
